Description_lang: A mechanical squirrel's logic center tells it to collect and store both nuts and bolts for the winter.
Donni Anthania plans to have a bombay buried with her when she dies. A wise adventurer can put its talents to much better use.
Donni Anthania invites these cats to her tea parties. But she doesn't serve their favorite drink: the tears of their enemies.
Old Alterac saying: 'A cat has nine lives, but needs only one.'
The last person who tried to housebreak this cat quickly learned that a soiled rug is better than a shredded everything-else.
Known for its blue eyes. Also considered a delicacy by giant murlocs.
Sleeping is this cat's second favorite activity. The first is yawning.
'The queen had three kittens. The first gave her a juicy rat. The second, a tasty hare. And the white, her favorite, presented the head of her rival.'
Some say this clever bird can be taught to speak--but it's smart enough to keep its beak shut.
The jungle trolls train these birds to mimic calls for help in order to lure unsuspecting travelers into traps.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop: |rWorld Drop|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rNorthern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

Description_lang: Favored pet of the Defias pirates, this colorful bird is handy for remembering passwords, grocery lists, and cracker recipes.
Favored pet of the goblins of Booty Bay, this colorful bird is renowned for its ability to count coins, tally budgets, and lie about contracts.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Vendor: |rNarkk, Harry No-Hooks|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Cape of Stranglethorn|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r40|TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-SILVERICON.BLP:0|t|n|n|cFFFFD200Vendor: |rDealer Rashaad|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rNetherstorm|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r40|TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-SILVERICON.BLP:0|t

Description_lang: It thinks you taste like chicken too.
The cockroach is usually an impulse buy. Its owners have a hard time parting with it even after numerous attempts.
Hopes that someday it can grow up to destroy villages, just like mommy.
Like other members of the blue dragonflight, these whimsical little critters display an affinity to arcane magic.
Hailing from the Wetlands, this young dragon is just learning how to hunt, breathe fire, and go on cute destructive rampages.
Once bred and raised by the green dragon Itharius, this unique breed of dragon has settled in the jungles of Feralas.
Vendors at the Darkmoon Faire offer strange and exotic wonders. They also sell wood frogs.
Known for their powerful legs and keen eyesight.
This dark-feathered bird of prey is often seen as a harbinger of doom amongst the druids of Teldrassil.
Night elf children are given an owl feather on their first birthday as a token of good luck.
Winterspring's furbolg prize the brilliant white feathers of these majestic creatures for ritual purposes.
A complex system of burrows protects the prairie dog from its neighbors' massive hooves.
If you go chasing snowshoe rabbits, you know you're going to fall.
A favored companion of Kirin Tor magi, this reptile makes one wonder whether it's truly a snake or something else altogether.
Xan'tish fearlessly tracks, captures, and trains these noble snakes so they will aid their comrades in battle.
The brown snake is native to Horde-controlled territories. It seems unremarkable until its victims are within range.
The crimson snake is favored among the Darkspear trolls for not only its vicious nature, but also its steadfast loyalty.
Not to worry; the combat mechanisms and homing logic have been disabled on this unit, I think. --Oglethorpe Obnoticus
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r An OOX of Your Own|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Booty Bay|n

Description_lang: Don't call this bird chicken unless you want egg on your face.
Possibly explosive, definitely adorable. Keep away from open flame.
This tiny peacekeeper security bot is often outfitted with the latest arcane nullifiers and crowd pummelers. Not for the environmentally minded.
These adorable critters love snuggling with their owners after a long day of brutal, bloody battle.
Worgs are the favored companions of orcs and are fiercely loyal on the battlefield.
Although born in the warm heights of Blackrock Spire, the smolderweb hatchling can survive most environments.
This pint-sized panda cub is highly sought after by adventurers around Azeroth - despite its narcoleptic nature.
AND THE HEAVENS SHALL TREMBLE, AND MAN SHALL WEEP, AND THE END OF DAYS SHALL--wait, why are you so tall?
A small, fierce member of the Zerg swarm, the zergling is not to be trifled with. Very dangerous in high numbers.
Talented engineers have crafted an exact replica of a wood frog, at only ten times the cost of buying the real thing.
The legendary ale frog was believed to be extinct until the strange brews at the Darkmoon Faire brought them out of hiding.
Appearances of this beloved and ultra-reclusive murloc are sure to draw a crowd.
Lurky's charming disposition and lively antics are guaranteed to soothe frustration and lighten even the darkest moods.
Warning: Wear gloves and goggles while handling disgusting oozeling. DO NOT WASH. Will stain most armor.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r World Drop|n|cFFFFD200Creature:|r Oozes, Slimes and Worms

Description_lang: After birth, newborn sharks quickly flee their hungry mothers. Their early independence makes them dangerous, even while young.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Profession:|r Fishing|n|cFFFFD200Vendor:|r Nat Pagle|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Garrison, Fishing Shack|n|cFFFFD200Cost:|r 50|Tinterface\icons\inv_misc_coin_19.blp:0|t

Description_lang: This clever toy is equipped with a secret switch to disable its 'tranquil' mode. Luckily, even the engineers who built it don't know how to find it.
He loves to dance and wave and play with you! He melts after Winter Veil, but don't worry; he'll be back again someday!
Would rather not spend any more time inside a wrapped holiday gift box.
These off-season allies work tirelessly to prepare for the Feast of Winter Veil, and would appreciate not being disturbed the rest of the year.
During the majestic Winter Veil celebration, these faithful companions spread joy throughout the land. The rest of the year, they are busy.
Gurky is a born performer, though she remains elusive, making public appearances only on the rarest of occasions.
The power of love can be a dangerous thing, especially when wielded by an airborne, ill-tempered goblin.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Love is in the Air|n|cFFFFD200Vendor: |rLovely Merchant|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r40|TINTERFACE\ICONS\INV_ValentinesCard01:0|t|n

Description_lang: This cub shares many traits with its relatives, but it's in a league of its own with its singing ability.
Slow and steady wins the race.
Many assume 'Wiggles' refers to the motion of this pig's posterior. They discover the true meaning when they see their own entrails.
A clever tactician, Whiskers will feign death to fool predators and bill collectors.
This little piece of summer smells of warm evenings and lightning storms. If you look closely, you might be able to make out a face.
After a harpy incursion in Feralas, several hippogryph nesting grounds were attacked. Hundreds of hatchlings were orphaned, and they have been entrusted to the care of the druids on Sardor Isle.
Offspring of the nether drakes of Outland, this young dragon is still growing into its role as hunter, protector, and adorable terror of the skies.
Only magical wishes make magical crawdads. If you wish for a fish, fish for a wish.
The ethereal Rashaad began breeding these enigmatic creatures after learning of their ability to feed on arcane energies.
This bunny is the cutest thing its opponent will ever see. It'll also be the last.
Delicate denizen of Azuremyst Isle, this magical insect has been rumored to possess healing abilities.
A product of exposure to wild magical energies, this insect is the unexpectedly colorful result of Azerothian moth species being released into the eco-domes of the Netherstorm.
Prefers flying during thunderstorms, which are common in Azuremyst Isle.
Prefers flying during foggy nights, which are common in Azuremyst Isle.
Once prized by dragonhawk breeders in Silvermoon. Stands out at night to predators, making it necessary to gain awareness at an early age.
Mortal enemies with silver dragonhawks; on pretty good terms with golden dragonhawks.
Ferocious species of dragonhawk, often seen diving down on prey from high in the sky.
Raised by the few dealers still willing to trade in Netherstorm.
Commonly used by sporelings as a light source as they navigate the waterways of Zangarmarsh, this luminescent insect helps them avoid the dangerous bogflare needlers.
The magical energies released during Skywing's transformation back into his true arakkoa form liberated this poor creature, a fledgling bird imprisoned by Luanga in order to power his fowl curse.
Many a drunken Brewfest goer has told the tale of this mysterious creature, but few remember that tale in the morning.
Lucky squeals when he's angry or when he's eating. Either way, you don't want to bother him.
Although loath to part with Bananas, Landro realized it would be safer if the pet was far from Booty Bay when his father, King Mukla, discovered he was missing.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r Through the Dark Portal

Description_lang: He's slightly evil but extremely narcoleptic. Keep him away from critters!
The sin'dorei use hawkstriders as mounts, but this little one was deemed unfit after being diagnosed with numerous anxiety disorders.
Domesticated elekks are trained as mounts by the draenei people. In the wild they are hunted for their ivory tusks.
Stinker uses his aroma to repel predators and attract cats. He's much more successful with the former than the latter.
This mischievous gourd likes to pop out of the ground and scare you right out of your pants. Hail to the pumpkin song!
The crocolisk's hide and meat are prized by hunters, but the beast is ferocious and seldom taken by surprise.
Muckbreath is just like other crocolisks, except he has an excellent sense of humor.
Amani witch doctors have turned many victims into frogs. Some never recover.
A shy creature, the pink elekk will only make its presence known to those that have befriended it, or to anyone too intoxicated to harm it.
Wild sporebats are vicious creatures, but if tamed at a young age, they can be loyal companions.
When the Burning Legion invaded Outland, Landro Longshot contributed this design to the war effort. Both the Alliance and Horde passed on production.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r March of the Legion

Description_lang: Much quieter than a real dragon.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r March of the Legion

Description_lang: This golden pig honors its ancestors by giving its allies good fortune.
Druids think silver pigs have a special bond with golden pigs, as both breeds appeared on Azeroth at the same time.
Elder shaman have warned that wisps of Ragnaros, loyal servants of the Firelord, have taken to the Molten Front.  Vigilance is advised.
Crocolisks are six-legged amphibian predators found in coastal waters. Archaeologists believe they may be descended from the diemetradons of Un'Goro Crater.
After studying the crocolisk species for several years, the famed angler Nat Pagle determined that baby crocolisks are mostly harmless.
A child of phoenix god Al'ar, the hatchling takes flight immediately after birth.
These stunning creatures, awarded to heroes for victory in battle, represent bravery and strength.
Only heroes who have proven their valor through great acts are gifted one of these mystical serpentine creatures.
Ethereal soul-traders will travel with those who can free the essences they need from unruly hosts.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r The Hunt for Illidan

Description_lang: Native to the Terokkar Forest, nether rays spawn during the rainy season. Out of the hundreds of offspring resulting from one hatching, very few survive to adulthood.
Vampire bats have been trained as scouts and mounts by the Forsaken of the Undercity and the Amani trolls of Zul'Aman.
Accidentally created when the Lich King's deathly powers raised Rimefang from undeath.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r Wrath of the Lich King Collector's Edition

Description_lang: 'I am Justice itself!'
When it senses the impending death of a nearby creature, the skull will emit an ear-piercing cackle.
This mechanical warrior is a favorite gift during Winter Veil. Batteries not included, but rockets definitely are!
Mr. Chilly's appearance evokes a more civilized era, when duelists battled in tuxedos.
You wouldn't want to meet this rat in a dark alley. Or anywhere else, for that matter.
Unlike most of Geen the gorloc's 'mysterious eggs,' this one actually contained a living thing.
The rare albino tickbird is revered amongst the Oracles. It is seen as a sign of heavy rainstorms, good grub harvests, and hibernating wolvar.
These voracious whelps grow at an incredible rate and can devour nearly twice their weight in raw meat per day.
The cobras of Azeroth are renowned for their fast-acting venom and swift strikes.
Notable for its wide eyes and sassy slide.

To prevent apprentices from secretly using the familiar to complete their chores, the archmagi placed the ritual required to summon the creature across the pages of several spellbooks hidden throughout Dalaran.
Spring rabbits symbolize fertility, and they love to demonstrate why.
He's humble, clairvoyant, and delicious with cranberry sauce.
This rare bear is bred for its small size and perpetually youthful appearance.
She likes the company of friends. Seventy-five of them, to be precise.
It always wakes up dancing. What a happy little tree!
The bears of Dun Morogh are prized for their hardiness, loyalty, and combat prowess. Their time among the dwarves does little to curb their ferocity.
Can sense an opponent's heartbeat through echolocation.
The volatile Durotar scorpion is a fierce desert predator. It's known for only occasionally stinging its owner.
Unlike the polymorphed variety, trueborn sheep can be quite scary.
A tallstrider's speed on open ground is unrivaled, so predators rely on stealth and pack tactics when hunting them.
The strand crawler has adapted to the northern cold by hibernating under the island beaches.
The long-term effects of the contamination caused by the Exodar are still under observation.
Created by a blood elf apprentice, this broom would be extremely useful if anyone could figure out how to make it stop.
Many of Stormwind's youth joined the Argent Crusade as squires, hoping to one day serve the Holy Light in battle.
Used as a training mount for young gnomes, the Mechanopeep has none of the speed but all of the charm of its bigger brothers.
These young orcs strive to embody the Argent Crusade's virtues: valor, strength, and integrity.
Murkimus is the most fearsome of all murloc arena warriors. And for a time, the only one.
This is actually three pets in one. You won't know what you'll get until you summon it!
A solemn reminder of what was lost when the Worldbreaker changed the face of Azeroth.
Many have mocked this cat before battle. Their last words are usually, 'Here, kitty, kitty.'
The bouncy gurloc is a distant cousin of the murloc.
Despite their smaller stature, the wolvar are some of the most aggressive creatures in Northrend. This often makes their curious nature intimidating.
A fighting robot fueled by delicious red or blue electrolytes.
Only the rarest of murlocs is able to successfully cross dimensional barriers. Fewer still return with the kind of advanced armor and weaponry possessed by Grunty.
This extremely rare species of mana wyrm is prized for its unique coloration and even temperament.
Considered to be lucky, tigers carved of jade are prized, but taming a jade tiger itself is an even greater prize.
Rarely leaves nest until maturity. Enjoys conducting pranks on the nearby Razormaw nest.
The demand for this purple-skinned breed has drastically reduced the raptor population near the Wailing Caverns.
This crafty raptor was born in the icy wastes of Northrend. Its harsh upbringing gives it strength when many others would perish.
This offspring of Takk the Leaper is incredibly agile and can maneuver through difficult environments with ease.
This hatchling is coveted for its unique coloration. Despite Breanni's loving care, the raptor's feral nature cannot be restrained.
Larger than other raptor infants, these hatchlings grow into towering reptilian beasts capable of massive devastation.
Razormaw eggs are protected fiercely by their mothers. Their cuteness belies their inherited ferocity.
Razzashi raptors are among the cleverest predators in the jungle, making them favored by the Gurubashi trolls.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop: |rWorld Drop|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rNorthern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

Description_lang: The onyx panther is invisible at night, like a stalking shadow, and disappears with the dawn.
Seeing these kites soaring above Northrend's shores is a clear sign that tuskarr are nearby.
Affectionate and curious, these kittens seem to find the most peculiar hiding places.
Spawn of Onyxia, this young dragon has decided that it doesn't want to follow in its grandfathers' cataclysmic footsteps.
Found in the Firelands and the Molten Core, core hounds can trace their lineage back to the alpha male, Magmadar.
A gift from the Wildhammer dwarves to the heroes of the Alliance, these hatchlings are descendants of the same gryphons ridden by Falstad and his entourage into Grim Batol.
Thorg No-Legs never paid heed to the old orc saying, 'Don't pull a wyvern's tail.'
A rarely seen family of tigers, many believe (perhaps incorrectly) that some residual magic or other event is responsible for the unique color.
The pandaren monk is a fearless traveling companion, constantly training in his art... unless you offer him a drink. He considers it rude to refuse.
In life, Kel'Thuzad betrayed the Kirin Tor and created the Cult of the Damned. In death, he serves the Scourge as the Archlich Lord of Naxxramas.
Although small, pugs are very dangerous when provoked.
This, um, 'adorable' little guy likes to play with critters. Just don't let them get too close.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Love is in the Air

Description_lang: While not nearly as destructive as its original master, the Ice Lord Ahune, the frostling has been known to lob chilly snowballs at unsuspecting adventurers.
Jepetto's top-selling toy this season, the bot's new blue chassis has children across Azeroth scrambling for this feisty battle bot.
Breanni in Dalaran, one of the world's foremost collectors of exotic pets, will only award the mystical Celestial Dragon to fellow collectors whose obsession rivals her own.
Modeled after the huge titan prototype in Ulduar, this volatile little construct plays hard with its toys.
Murkimus is the most fearsome of all murloc arena warriors. And the only one.
Powerful artillery of the Terran army. The Thor is always the first one in and the last one out!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r StarCraft II: Wings of Liberty Collector's Edition

Description_lang: Unlike its gold counterpart, the blue mini jouster takes a leisurely pace when jabbing its opponent's eyeballs.
This critter is infamous for its ability to unleash a fast and furious eyeball jabbing.
Goblin engineering at its finest. Blueprints based on the massive fel reaver in Hellfire Peninsula.
The gold standard for sturdy gnomish design, this mechanical critter is the perfect companion for the lonely engineer on the go.
This appears to be nothing more than the paw of a small primate. A closer inspection shows that the hand has been dried by centuries of exposure to the sands of Uldum.
An adventurous little elemental, Pebble escaped hungry gyreworms in the Crumbling Depths, braved the emptiness of the Twisting Nether, and ultimately found himself rescued from a mailbox.
You stare at her, and she just stares right back. So clever; sometimes it seems as if she's figuring out how to open doors.
Reduces the likelihood of being eaten by monsters when you enter pitch-black places.
Nations tremble under his shadow - the Destroyer, the one-time Aspect of Earth, and the monster responsible for breaking Azeroth asunder.  Now in a convenient travel-size!
Fire hatchlings are born from the ashes of a phoenix. Dark hatchlings emerge from their shadows.
This bird is a salty veteran of the endless naval battles surrounding Tol Barad--a veteran whose grown plump from picking through the leftovers, that is.
Rolls into a protective ball when it feels threatened. Or when its mother calls.
Thought to be an original construct of the titans, the clockwork gnome has some gears smaller than the eye can see.
The fighting in Tol Barad has made it difficult to find these kits, and numerous would-be owners have decimated the fox population there as a result.
The elemental shale spider is no true arachnid, but it has durability and ferocity that make it feared even in Deepholm.
Guild pages must be fearless since they are called upon to announce their guild's victories over the Horde in battle.
When a guild earns enough glory by defeating Alliance champions, some orcs will come to share the glory by serving the guild.
When guilds have accumulated enough wealth, brave soldiers are often called to bear their standards.
Wealthy guilds draw the attention of soldiers willing to carry their standards into battle.
Always 'ready to play,' Landro's Lil' XT is almost indistinguishable from the original. Prone to tantrums and narcolepsy.
The grubs of the Plaguelands are a side effect of necromantic corruption and the massive number of corpses there. Mr. Grubbs is from a particularly acrobatic breed.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Drop:|r Eastern Plaguelands (requires Fiona's Lucky Charm)

Description_lang: After swarming around open lava pits during the day, these strange insects emit a fiery glow at night.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r SEVEN! YUP!, Not Fireflies, Flameflies|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Burning Steppes|n

Description_lang: You'll find him in his shell, exactly where a snail has to be!
This sweet flower will brighten your day with its warm smile and cheerful song! Also strong against undead.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r Lawn of the Dead|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Hillsbrad Foothills|n

Description_lang: Higitus figi- hockity pocki- abracadab- prestidig--oh, pinfeathers!
Often confused by miners as a rare gem, the geode initially makes its presence known by emitting melodic reverberations.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Elementium Vein, Rich Elementium Vein|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Deepholm, Twilight Highlands, Uldum

Description_lang: Deathwing's emergence transformed the whole of Azeroth; not even the ocean-dwelling murlocs were immune to his corrupt influence.
Moonkin are blessed by Elune and spread nature's grace wherever they travel. The festive fowls are always in the mood for a dance.
It's never too soon to summon this tiny aspect of the dread Firelord.
The distinct roar of the moonkin is one of the most terrifying sounds in nature.
It looked up at you with those huge black eyes and seemed to ask, 'Are you my mommy?'
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r Some Good Will Come|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Northern Stranglethorn|n|n

Description_lang: How the goblin Landro Longshot initially came into possession of the lichling remains a mystery, but he was all too eager to wager it in a game of cards.
Elune made nightsabers silver and black so they could meld into the shadows on a moonlit night.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r Twilight of the Dragons

Description_lang: Winterspring cubs are happiest when frolicking in freshly fallen snow.
Born in the jungles of Stranglethorn, unlucky raptor hatchlings are often captured by the Gurubashi and taken to the troll city of Zul'Gurub.
Wild marsh walkers are dangerously aggressive, but they're loyal and affectionate if you manage to tame them.
Pterrordax eggs are incubated underneath the fossils of their forebears, allowing the hatchlings to absorb their ancestors' ferocity and intelligence.
Voodoo figurines were often empowered by flasks of mojo, troll sweat, and the flesh of tribal enemies.
Still a little clumsy, this tiny winged lion is learning how to be the best mount it can be!
Not yet the fearsome creatures they grow to in adulthood, the Cenarion hatchlings have an almost harmless appearance that has caught novice trainers of the Cenarion Circle off guard.
The cubs of Hyjal suffered much during the Cataclysm. On the bright side, the devastation also led to their newfound love of heights and daredevil stunts.
Native to the ashen soils of the Firelands, the lasher was transplanted to Azeroth with the help of the Guardians of Hyjal.
Ride with the moon (and this furry, whiskered witch) in the dead of night!
A legendary member of the blue dragonflight.
Previous owners of the crate have reported the disappearance of other pets from their collection.
Most squirrels hoard acorns for sustenance. Nuts, on the other hand, hoards acorns to stock its supply of ammunition.
One of the rarest creatures, this kaliri is set apart from others by its brilliant plumage and the lengths hunters will go to capture them.
You might think this fish out of water would be a weak opponent... until you see the intensity that lies within its protective bubble.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r Throne of the Tides

Description_lang: When you're confronting Murkablo or any of the Prime Murlocs, possession of a soulstone is strongly advised.
The monkeys of Azeroth are infamous tricksters, and these beloved companions of the Darkmoon Faire have taken that innate cunning to a whole new level.
Created to entertain children at the Darkmoon Faire, these magical balloons never lose their floatiness.
A magical wonder, these balloons will never deflate and are traditionally created in batches of ninety-nine.
The grell are embodiments of the wild side of nature. Tame ones are very rare.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r Crown of the Heavens

Description_lang: This shelled reptile bravely protects the home on its back with an unwaveringly happy disposition.
It just floats along...
A stowaway from Greatfather Winter's workshop, this tiny elemental found himself trapped in a present that was stolen by the Abominable Greench.
A favorite of children across Azeroth, this tough little toy can withstand even the most aggressive imagination.
Lacking the mines and rockets of its predecessor, this kid-friendly faire prize is a new favorite among Azeroth's children.
Despite its diminutive size, it is impossible to miss a sea pony cutting through the water.
These magical lanterns are acquired at the Lunar Festival, which celebrates the defeat of the Burning Legion by the free races of Azeroth.
The light from each lantern honors the soul of an ancestor spirit. During the Lunar Festival, these ghostly elders pass along their wisdom to the current generation.
This snuggly kitten loves to frolic, but sometimes it seems to be chasing things that aren't really there.
Fetish shaman are empowered by the spirits of their fallen ancestors. These malevolent spirits are bound to the shaman's tribal spear. Control this spear, and you control the shaman.
The Soul of the Aspects is said to be possessed of mercurial moods ranging from stoic and deliberate to unpredictable and erratic, to loving and deeply pensive.
Always watching. Always judging.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game: |rTimewalkers: War of the Ancients|n

Description_lang: Offspring of the black sheep, the black lamb is only found in the forests of Elwynn.
When you have two rabbits, you'll often soon have three.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzshara, Blade's Edge Mountains, Crystalsong Forest, Darkshore, Dun Morogh, Duskwood, Elwynn Forest, Eversong Woods, Feralas, Highmountain, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Mulgore, Nagrand, Redridge Mountains, Silvermoon City, Silverpine Forest, Stonetalon Mountains, Stormwind City, Tirisfal Glades, Western Plaguelands, Westfall, Wetlands

Description_lang: Most people do not know the difference between a squirrel and a chipmunk. Most don't care.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAmmen Vale, Ashenvale, Azshara, Blade's Edge Mountains, Crystalsong Forest, Darkshore, Dun Morogh, Duskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Elwynn Forest, Feralas, Gilneas, Highmountain, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Loch Modan, Magisters' Terrace, Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Nagrand, Ruins of Gilneas, Sholazar Basin, Silverpine Forest, Spires of Arak, Stormwind City, Teldrassil, Terokkar Forest, Tol Barad Peninsula, Twilight Highlands, Val'sharah, Well of Eternity, Western Plaguelands, Westfall, Wetlands, Zul'Aman

Description_lang: It's hard to know what's more dangerous: the teeth or the tail.
Despite the name you should absolutely never, ever pet it.
This unique species of faerie dragon is not usually found on Azeroth.
It seems like a trick to the eyes, but the eternal strider can walk across water, its small feet never breaking the surface.
The thick pelt of the otter makes it adaptable to any climate, but it particularly prefers frigid waters where abalone is plentiful.
It seems that mice are completely incapable of resisting cheese even in the face of imprisonment, injury, or death.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDuskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Grizzly Hills, Mulgore, Netherstorm, Westfall, Wetlands

Description_lang: Distinct from their tree dwelling cousins, these ground squirrels make their homes on the plains of Azeroth and beyond.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rArathi Highlands, Mulgore, Nagrand, Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens, Thunder Bluff, Westfall

Description_lang: Due to recent accidents, the goblin cartels have prohibited anyone from bringing snakes on a zeppelin.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDustwallow Marsh, Eversong Woods, Feralas, Ghostlands, Howling Fjord, Loch Modan, Nagrand, Northern Stranglethorn, Sholazar Basin, Silverpine Forest, Terokkar Forest, Westfall, Zangarmarsh, Zul'Drak

Description_lang: These arthropods line many Azerothian shores and seek to fulfill their one true desire: to pinch.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAzshara, Borean Tundra, Howling Fjord, Krasarang Wilds, Nagrand (Draenor), Twilight Highlands, Westfall

Description_lang: The tiny harvester collects weeds and small grains that the larger reapers may have missed.
When they look into those big brown eyes, some hunters have a hard time pulling the trigger. So they shoot from a distance.
Mountain cottontails can leap up a steep incline with speed you would not believe.
The rats in Redridge grow fat from feasting on the bounty of the village larders.
They were here long before us and will be here long after we are gone.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBurning Steppes, Eastern Plaguelands, Gorgrond, Icecrown, Iron Docks, The Hinterlands, Twilight Highlands, Un'Goro Crater, Wetlands

Description_lang: "Little Bo Peep has lost her sheep, and doesn't know where to find them. Leave them alone, and they'll come OH MY GOD THEY'RE INSIDE THE HOUSE!"
Always wear a helm in the Redridge Mountains. Buzzards view humanoid hair as excellent nesting material.
Native to Duskwood, these eight-legged critters are often used as ingredients in alchemy potions.
Skunks are known as solitary creatures for reasons which are hopefully obvious.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAmmen Vale, Azshara, Bloodmyst Isle, Duskwood, Gilneas, Howling Fjord, Nagrand (Draenor), Terokkar Forest|n

Description_lang: While many people believe black cats to be bad luck, black rats are held in higher esteem.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBadlands, Duskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Eastern Plaguelands, Thousand Needles, Twilight Highlands, Western Plaguelands, Wetlands|n

Description_lang: Years ago, humans introduced these reptiles into Duskwood to cull the local rat population.
Widow spiderlings have plenty of time to explore Duskwood once they take care of their pesky family commitments.
The low tide reveals the colonies of strand crabs and the sound of their clicking dance as they feed upon small creatures hidden in the sand.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDarkshore, Dragonblight, Dun Morogh, Gilneas, Kezan, Northern Stranglethorn, Spires of Arak, Swamp of Sorrows, The Cape of Stranglethorn, The Lost Isles

Description_lang: Prefers to dwell in wet, muddy areas and feed on Sorrowmoss nectar.
Parrots can mimic speech, but have difficulty with meaningful conversation.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rNorthern Stranglethorn, Swamp of Sorrows, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

Description_lang: Thought by many to be nothing more than the subject of children's nursery rhymes, the long-tailed mole is very much real.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDun Morogh, Northern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

Description_lang: Stranglethorn's Gurubashi trolls often capture these powerful beasts to keep as pets... or to cook as meals.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rNorthern Stranglethorn, Tanaan Jungle, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

Description_lang: A hardy insect that can dwell in just about any climate, the beetle is known to thrive on battlefields after the fighting has ended.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBadlands, Eastern Plaguelands, Felwood, Northern Stranglethorn, Silithus, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Un'Goro Crater

Description_lang: This vicious species weaves elaborate webs throughout the dense jungles of Stranglethorn Vale.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rHighmountain, Northern Stranglethorn, Shadowmoon Valley, The Cape of Stranglethorn

Description_lang: If a female lizard does not lay her clutch in a well camouflaged area, her eggs will likely be devoured by Lashtail Raptors.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rNorthern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

Description_lang: Parrots can't get enough of the fresh fish the Bloodscalp trolls eat. They're less interested in dry flatbreads.
Just like the rough and tumble sailors who live dockside, the wharf rats are feral, violent creatures.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rIron Docks, The Cape of Stranglethorn, Tol Barad Peninsula

Description_lang: Young apes quickly learn to hang from branches with their feet, leaving both hands free to fling objects at interlopers.
The most common of the arachnid family, these critters spin their webs in nearly every corner of Azeroth.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAhn'kahet: The Old Kingdom, Azjol-Nerub, Azshara, Black Temple, Blasted Lands, Drak'Tharon Keep, Dun Morogh, Dustwallow Marsh, Eastern Plaguelands, Elwynn Forest, Ghostlands, Gilneas, Gilneas City, Halls of Reflection, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Icecrown Citadel, Karazhan, Naxxramas, Orgrimmar, Pit of Saron, Ruins of Gilneas, Shadowmoon Valley (Draenor), Stonetalon Mountains, Swamp of Sorrows, Teldrassil, The Culling of Stratholme, The Forge of Souls, The Hinterlands, The Storm Peaks, The Violet Hold, Tirisfal Glades, Utgarde Keep, Utgarde Pinnacle, Winterspring, Zul'Aman, Zul'Drak

Description_lang: Venom capable of killing creatures up to 100 times its own body weight.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBlade's Edge Mountains, Blasted Lands, Burning Steppes, Eastern Plaguelands, Hellfire Peninsula, Orgrimmar, Shadowmoon Valley, Silithus, Thousand Needles, Twilight Highlands

Description_lang: Drawn to heat and the smell of smoke, the fire beetle's diet consists of ash.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBlasted Lands, Burning Steppes, Mount Hyjal, Searing Gorge, Un'Goro Crater

Description_lang: Despite its snapping claws and venom-dripping tail, it is the bite of the diminutive scorpling that is the greatest threat.
The intrepid archaeologist Harrison Jones has a well documented fear of rats.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAmmen Vale, Arathi Basin, Arathi Highlands, Ashenvale, Azshara, Bloodmyst Isle, Crystalsong Forest, Darkshore, Desolace, Drak'Tharon Keep, Dun Morogh, Frostfire Ridge, Ghostlands, Gilneas, Gilneas City, Highmountain, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Karazhan, Loch Modan, Nagrand, Naxxramas, Ruins of Gilneas, Scarlet Monastery, Shattrath City, Silverpine Forest, Spires of Arak, Stonetalon Mountains, Stormwind City, Sunken Temple, Swamp of Sorrows, Terokkar Forest, The Cape of Stranglethorn, The Culling of Stratholme, The Deadmines, The Hinterlands, The Lost Isles, The Shattered Halls, The Violet Hold, Timeless Isle, Tirisfal Glades, Tanaan Jungle

Description_lang: Brought to Orgrimmar aboard merchant ships, these short-lived reptiles are considered pests by the city's residents.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDurotar, Northern Stranglethorn, Orgrimmar, Swamp of Sorrows, Twilight Highlands, Wetlands

Description_lang: This is a small frog.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rArathi Highlands, Darnassus, Desolace, Elwynn Forest, Eversong Woods, Ghostlands, Loch Modan, Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens, Swamp of Sorrows, Teldrassil, Zangarmarsh

Description_lang: The song of late summer nights is the song of toads.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAshenvale,  Durotar, Dustwallow Marsh, Eversong Woods, Felwood, Ghostlands, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Nagrand, Orgrimmar, Silverpine Forest, Swamp of Sorrows, Teldrassil, Twilight Highlands, Wetlands

Description_lang: Prefers to dwell in humid, tropical areas and feed on Kingsblood nectar.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rNorthern Stranglethorn, The Cape of Stranglethorn

Description_lang: When hunting or evading predators, this snake can travel on the surface of water for short distances.
The thick exoskeleton of this adaptable arthropod allows it to thrive in harsh environments.
A nuisance to most, roaches' incredible survivability sets them apart from other species.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAshenvale, Azshara, Desolace, Dun Morogh, Duskwood, Gilneas, Gilneas City, Howling Fjord, Icecrown Citadel, Kezan, Loch Modan, Northern Stranglethorn, Razorfen Downs, Redridge Mountains, Stonetalon Mountains, The Cape of Stranglethorn, The Culling of Stratholme, Thousand Needles, Tirisfal Glades|n

Description_lang: This ill-tempered snake species makes its home around the fiery molten pits of the Burning Steppes.
The rock-hard carapaces of these spiders allow them to survive in the Searing Gorge's blistering heat.
These blisteringly hot spiders camouflage themselves by blending in with oozing magma.
Beetles in the Burning Steppes roll magma into tiny balls and eat them once they cool off.
Tiny, autonomous machines created by the Titans to clean and maintain their mighty edifices.
Wildhammer dwarves train young gryphons by sending them out to hunt rattlesnakes in the Twilight Highlands.
Less venomous but more aggressive than other breeds of scorpion.
The coloration of the spiky lizard allows it to blend in seamlessly with the desert sands of Silithus.
When a ram lowers his head, it means he's preparing to charge. Or he could just be tired.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rArathi Highlands, Hillsbrad Foothills, Loch Modan, Ruins of Gilneas, Wetlands

Description_lang: These rams hone their fighting skills by head-butting twigs and saplings near Loch Modan.
This snake is often seen sunning on the exposed rocks high in the Badlands.
These creatures are silent, save for the occasional sigh of otherworldly despair.
The thick snow near Dun Morogh acts as camouflage for snow cubs learning to hunt.
The alpine hare can burrow into the permafrost and hibernate for weeks or even months.
Most creatures cannot withstand a fraction of the harsh conditions that roaches can thrive in.
Despite their idyllic surroundings, grasslands cottontails hop at surprising speed when evading their pursuers.
Twisters delight in sneaking up on unsuspecting creatures and surprising them with gusts up their nostrils.
Jade Oozelings glow in the dark, making them a welcome sight to workers in pitch-black mineshafts.
Pay attention to deer crossings. Even a fawn will total a goblin trike.
A carrot, a box, a stick, and some string. Wait a few hours and you'll have a hare.
Distinct from their Azerothian relatives, these critters of Outland make their home in Blade's Edge Mountains.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBlade's Edge Mountains, Gorgrond, The Hinterlands

Description_lang: The preferred habitat of this creature is woodland areas where it can safely complete its metamorphosis.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAshenvale, Ghostlands, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, The Hinterlands, Tirisfal Glades, Tanaan Jungle

Description_lang: According to the tales of the night elves, the first red-tailed chipmunk was colored so after the theft and consumption of a sacred apple.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDarnassus, Desolace, Hillsbrad Foothills, Talador, Teldrassil

Description_lang: Infested cubs still listen for the telltale buzzing of bees even though they can no longer taste honey.
Even the rats of Lordaeron fell to the apothecaries' plague, chewing upon the tainted flesh of the dead.
Undead squirrels have acquired a taste for the strange berries and mushrooms that now grow in Silverpine Forest.
Curiously, this hawk uses its razor-sharp talons to peel the bark off trees as it searches for bugs, even though it has no need for sustenance.
It can swallow three times its own body weight in blood.
These small spirits find their undead neighbors to be poor company, so they typically wander Tirisfal Glades alone.
After centuries of domestication, these furry critters inhabit nearly every human nation in the Eastern Kingdoms.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rArathi Highlands, Elwynn Forest, Eversong Woods, Netherstorm, Silvermoon City

Description_lang: Small elemental saplings grow into treants, fierce defenders of forests and groves.
This new arrival to Azeroth was spawned a short time ago. It seeks to thrive while awaiting its next phase of evolution.
[DEBUG] This pet comes from the magical Test Land where it frolics all day in fields of structs.
The souls of slain crabs seek vengeance against the murlocs who ate them.
You can easily locate moths if you wear expensive garments near Ammen Vale. They can't resist the delicious taste of high fashion.
These voracious carnivores first arrived on Azeroth aboard the draenei's dimensional fortress, the Exodar.
The children of Orgrimmar frequently capture these lizards as pets.  The adults of Orgrimmar frequently step on them.
A desert dwelling forager attracted to areas rich with dung.
These beetles often make their homes in quarries abandoned by the Horde war machine in Durotar.
An enigmatic species, said to feed off the chaotic energies of the Old Gods.
Twisted by the Twilight Hammer's dark magic, these sinister critters are known to feed on their own young.
Originally built by an irate goblin to annoy neighbors with an early morning wake-up call.
Considered by most to be a significant improvement to the 4000 series, there were nonetheless serious concerns about the amount of heat they produced.
Turtles are feared by the naga, who consider them bad luck and give them a wide berth on the shores of Azshara.
These playful feline cubs practice their hunting skills by stalking each other through the Barrens.
The barbaric centaur over-hunted giraffes for decades, but it was the tauren who saved this species from extinction.
Most people only see gazelles from the rear.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDesolace, Mulgore, Northern Barrens, Southern Barrens

Description_lang: Young gazelles quickly learn to flee when they hear the war cries of tauren hunters in Mulgore.  They don't hear the good hunters, unfortunately.
Prefers to dwell in cool, forested areas and feed on Mageroyal nectar.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rAshenvale, Darnassus, Desolace, Moonglade, Mount Hyjal, Teldrassil

Description_lang: Their proximity to the magic of the elves has caused some of them unnatural long life. And in some elfin rabbits...stranger things.
Prized by gem crafters, the undamaged carapace of a topaz hatchling can be used to create stunning inlays for rings and bracelets.
Long ago, Mount Hyjal's druids tempered this species to live in peace alongside the region's other creatures.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBlade's Edge Mountains, Desolace, Mount Hyjal, Silithus

Description_lang: There are many scholars who question whether it is a toad or not.
This cunning species tunnels beneath Uldum and erupts from the ground to ensnare its prey.
When these sleepy critters aren't snoozing, they use their massive claws to dig for tasty insect snacks.
It's called a mule because of its big ears. Also been known to transport black market bloodthistle over the border to Quel'Thalas.
Many an explorer has been entranced by the adorable nature of the alpine chipmunk, failing to notice its small teeth on frostbitten digits.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rHighmountain, Mount Hyjal, Stonetalon Mountains, Winterspring|n

Description_lang: Brave assassins sometimes capture these critters to use their highly toxic venom to poison weapons.
These vicious fire-breathing whelps escaped Onyxia's lair and fled into the surrounding region. Handle with extreme caution.
Originally bred by the Sandfury trolls as pets, these feral and savage felines prowl the deserts of Tanaris.
A desert-dwelling insect which defends its eggs by spraying a foul, ogrelike scent.
Hunts for food just below the water's surface on the coast of Darkshore.
These hatchlings entertain themselves by clacking their mandibles together in increasingly complex rhythms.
For every frog, a prince and princess in waiting.
Don't let their lack of a face fool you--these slimy critters are angry and just itching for a fight.
Even cockroaches were not strong enough to withstand the foul seepage of demonic corruption.
Prefers to dwell in corrupted woodlands and feed on Purple Lotus nectar.
There are some things too dirty even for rats.
These ill-tempered constructs of flame and rage sometimes rise from the remains of larger infernals who fall in battle.
The dwarven explorer who first discovered the spotted bell frog could not decide between naming it after the unique spot pattern or the sound of the frog's mating ritual. She chose both.
Prefers to dwell in the shadow of Nordrassil and feed on Stormvine nectar.
Diemetradons abandon their hatchlings in Un'Goro Crater to fend for themselves. Only the strongest survive.
Although most reptiles enjoy basking in sunlight, these scaly beasts love bathing in the glow of Azeroth's twin moons.
These eight-legged critters have lurked in the shadowy cliffs of the Stonetalon Mountains for millennia.
Many owls nest high in the stone structures of Darnassus, hunting any pests that enter the night elves' city.
The fur of the darkshore bears owes to the almost perpetual gloom they live in, and their vision in the darkness is uncanny.
These small elementals cling to the backs of larger mire beasts, picking off tasty bugs and mites.
Many a young gnomish inventor has made up for the death of a beloved pet by creating a mechanical friend in its image.
Native to Azeroth's desert regions, these resilient reptiles can survive for weeks without water.
Spawn of the nefarious Shrieker Scarabs of Ahn'Qiraj, the hatchlings are much more docile (and quiet) than their parents.
The squeaks used by these tiny insectoids may sound cute, but they're actually screaming for your death.
A brash fel orc once tried to enslave these critters as his personal soldiers. Pieces of him are still scattered across Outland.
These pudgy little beings often get themselves into trouble while hunting down their favorite snack: glow caps.
After hatching, these twisted reptiles devour the weaker members of their clutches as an act of dominance.
For ogres, comparing a female's hair to a clefthoof's shaggy coat is a term of great endearment.
Born from demonic magic, these petulant little entities corrupt everything they touch with foul energies.
Adult nether rays are relatively docile, but their younglings are short-tempered and highly energetic beasts.
Howling Fjord teems with the ever shifting cycle of life. When a creature dies, its body is quickly consumed by maggots, which in turn pass those nutrients on to a number of other creatures.
A key food source during the Feast of Winter Veil.
This grumpy species of basilisk roams the Blade's Edge Mountains, avoiding contact with other critters whenever possible.
There's an old vrykul saying that goes, 'Let sleeping worgs lie, unless you don't want your face anymore.'
These living blobs of ooze lack even the most rudimentary form of intelligence, but that doesn't mean they can't be your friend.
The fierce wolvar hunt these ill-tempered brutes for their horns, which are then carved into talismans and other trinkets.
The taunka collect the feathers of these noble birds of prey to use in crude fortunetelling ceremonies.
The trolls of Zul'Drak inadvertently created these little beings while summoning water elementals to fight the Scourge.

Tundra penguins often gather in large groups on the ice for protection against aquatic threats. Unfortunately this makes them easy prey for humanoid hunters seeking meat, skins and other achievements.
These skulking little creatures hatch in nests built around the ancient dragon bones of central Northrend.
Kel'Thuzad once nursed a plague-infected whelp to adulthood, feeding it only the finest liquefied remains.
Grotto voles are often confused with mice. Never twice.
Where there is carrion, there will always be rats.
The outer member of the roaches' eggs protect the larva from incineration. It is here in incubation that they gain the ability to resist the fire and heat of the volcanic climate.
Flamboyantly colored and more exuberant than most frogs.
When the locusts swarm, you can hear nothing but the sound of their wings.
Prefers to dwell along desert streams, wells or watering holes and feed on Whiptail nectar.
Loves to rest inside footwear of unsuspecting travelers during the night.
Carrion feeders often found in large numbers within ancient unearthed tombs; they can survive long periods of time without feeding.
During the Third War, thousands of these mystical beings annihilated the demon lord Archimonde.
Too afraid to attempt flying until thrown from a great height.
Distinct from their plain dwelling relatives, these critters make their homes amidst the war-torn Twilight Highlands.
The mice of the highlands, perhaps twisted by the Twilight's Hammer, are aggressive and fight for dominance between each other.
Demonstrating that a little evil goes a long way, this fiendling uses its razor-sharp teeth and gaping maw to devour anything in its path.
In the lean times when adrift at sea, the sight of a rat was a welcome one.
Through experimentation, the mages of Dalaran have discovered that the powered remains of a crimson shale spider will greatly increase the conflagration of their fire spells.
The cockroaches of Deepholm can burrow into stone itself to make their nests.
A cousin to the Twilight Beetle, this insect has learned to feed on crystals which resonate with ancient energies.
Much like other faerie dragons, these playful and mystical flyers are born with a natural defense against magic.
During frigid nights in the Storm Peaks, these critters use their fluffy tails as a blanket to stay warm.
Therazane wore these spunky crimson elementals as jewelry before the azure craze swept through Deepholm.
The seagull is a coastal scavenger often found near the docks.
The coral adder's venom is so deadly that one bite has been known to kill a full grown kodo beast.
It is difficult to believe that Shen-zin Su, on whose shell rests all of the Wandering Isle, began life as a tiny emerald turtle.
In the jungle, every leaf could conceal a frog. Stop to check and it could be long gone.
When preparing to travel to distant locations, Pandaren will traditionally capture a mirror strider and safely relocate it to another body of water.
The Jade Forest's pandaren consider these reptiles distant relatives of the revered Jade Serpent, Yu'lon.
Hides in shell to escape claws of nearby crabs.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rGorgrond, Spires of Arak, Talador, The Jade Forest

Description_lang: One of the stranger nuisances to horticulturalists, garden frogs can cause untold damage to gardens.
There's a raging debate over whether tanukis are raccoons or dogs, but the distinction seems trivial when they're gnawing on your femur.
The Jade Forest's mountain hozen fear these venomous reptiles and often hunt them out of pure spite.
These tiny arthropods are Pandaria natives that call the area of the Windless Isle their home.
The sandy petrel flies high above the Windless Isle, safe from landbound predators.
This foreboding creature stalks the night skies of the Eastern Plaguelands, feeding on carrion.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rEastern Plaguelands, Mount Hyjal, Tirisfal Glades

Description_lang: More horrifying than its appearance is that the infected squirrels of the Plaguelands no longer hoard nuts, instead collecting rotten, decaying flesh.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBloodmyst Isle, Eastern Plaguelands, Silverpine Forest

Description_lang: Only the dimwitted or insane would mount an infected deer head on their wall. The good news is they'll fit right in with their new undead friends.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBloodmyst Isle, Eastern Plaguelands, Silverpine Forest

Description_lang: Only found on the shores of Kezan, this lovely sea creature can be a bit snarky.
Quoth the raven: the last word you said. It gets old.
Hunted for its beautifully patterned skin, this majestic species thrives alongside Azeroth's lush rivers.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rNorthern Barrens, Southern Barrens, Uldum, Un'Goro Crater

Description_lang: The ash lizard gets its name from the way its shed skin looks, with an appearance like burnt cinders.
The mountain skunk is most famous for its adventurous nature. No really, that is what it is famous for.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rGrizzly Hills, Stonetalon Mountains, The Storm Peaks, Wetlands, Winterspring

Description_lang: These strange critters glimmer like ice, allowing them to hide among Winterspring's snowy expanses.
Unlike other snakes that actively hunt, these crafty reptiles hide in thick foliage and ambush their prey.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBlasted Lands, Dun Morogh, Durotar, Grimrail Depot, Hellfire Peninsula, Nagrand, Northern Barrens, Northern Stranglethorn, Southern Barrens, Spires of Arak

Description_lang: These arachnids use their razor-sharp legs to carve tunnels in the solid rock of the Blade's Edge Mountains.
The nether roach has adapted to the cold vacuum of space and requires no air to survive. Inside it bears almost no resemblance to a common roach.
Distinct from their cousins found in warmer climes, these hardy critters make their homes in the icy wastes of Northrend.
With the extra large surface area of their legs, snowshoe hares are able to effortlessly hop along the snow while their pursuers get bogged down in the drifts.
The heart of an arctic hare beats twice as fast as a common hare.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rBorean Tundra, Dragonblight, The Storm Peaks, Zul'Drak

Description_lang: If not for being extremely accident prone, the fjord rat might take over the world.
Capable of flying, unlike domesticated types.
Tends to avoid crossing roads, regardless of motivations.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rDuskwood, Dustwallow Marsh, Elwynn Forest, Hillsbrad Foothills, Howling Fjord, Redridge Mountains, Terokkar Forest, Tirisfal Glades, Westfall, Wetlands|n

Description_lang: In the deep forest, even the small creatures must have the ferocity to fend for themselves.
This is a huge toad.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rHillsbrad Foothills, Swamp of Sorrows, Twilight Highlands, Zul'Drak

Description_lang: The rumors of the medicinal uses of the biletoad were believed to have been started by a particularly mischievous apothecary.
And you thought turnips at the dinner table were bad.
This bubble is way worse than a tank.
Easily mistaken for a common beetle, the sting of a sand scarab will quickly clear up the misconception should you be unlucky enough to be stung by one.
Whenever his forces would experience setbacks in Azeroth, Kil'jaeden would pull out Micronax and terrorize the local cat-like creatures of Argus to vent his frustrations.
Offspring of the Imperial Quilen.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r Mists of Pandaria Collector's Edition Pet

Description_lang: Unnoticed but to cats and ratcatchers, when Deathwing descended upon Stormwind all the rats beat a hasty retreat from the city. Only of late have they returned.
A goblin alchemist once claimed that the bite of this raccoon gave him the gift of prophecy. Turns out, it was just rabies.
These little green grubs are native to wilds of Pandaria. Its verdant coloration camouflages it from would-be predators.
You'll often find them perched high atop impossibly high and remote stone outcroppings. There are few creatures as sure of foot.
The mongoose is prized for its ability to drive off poisonous snakes.  Rikk-tikk-tikki-tikki-tchk!
This terrifying and highly venomous species leaps onto its prey from the Jade Forest's dense canopy.
The leopard tree frog was named for the way it pounces from branch to branch.
Many young raccoons rail against their strict curfews, complaining that dawn is way too early to go to bed.
There are few things more annoying for a farmer to find underfoot than a rooster looking for love.
The taciturn bandicoon's diet consists mostly of apples.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: Some druids say pandaren and raccoons are distant cousins, but never when a pandaren can hear them.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: Many believe that the quillrat is able to shoot its spines at aggressors.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds, Krasarang Wilds

Description_lang: Although the wounds caused by the young quillrat are seldom fatal, most predators seek easier prey.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: Known to feast on the tasty plants in Valley of the Four Winds.
The sifang otter lives near rivers and is normally friendly and playful.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: Otters swim by propelling themselves with their powerful tails and flexing their long bodies. Very fast in the water.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: Softshell turtle meat is considered a delicacy and is the key ingredient in soothing turtle bisque.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: The common folk remedy to a feverbite hatchling's bite is to dance wildly and try to sweat out the toxins before they can take hold.
Prized for their ability to spin cocoons of silk, in the wild, to the untrained eye, they can be difficult to discern.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Valley of the Four Winds|n

Description_lang: A rarity among arachnids, these non-venomous critters feed solely on plants and fruit.
The most delicious of the beetle family.
A daring, narcissist insect willing to brave any threat in its pursuit of the spotlight.
Feeds on small leaves and grass when full grown.
Angering a spiny terrapin will cause it to withdraw into its shell and begin to spin wildly towards an attacker.
Burrows deep into snowbanks to hide from predators.
Occasionally sneaks bites of food from kills made by much larger animals.
While stationary, the plains monitor will continuously flick its tail back and forth. From a distance this mimics the appearance of swaying tallgrass, camouflaging the lizard from aerial predators.
On the prairie there are numerous rodents and other small creatures, but none more common than the mouse.
Will only lay eggs in bright light.
In the ancient fables, the first Tolai hare strode across the gulf between the stars before it upset them and they tumbled from the heavens to the world below.
Tolai hare pups are sent from their dens at a young age to find their own way.
These reptiles possess hooked scales, allowing them to slither up Kun-Lai Summit's rocky slopes and steep cliffs.
Known to flourish in the rainy season, this insect is drawn to lightning storms.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Dread Wastes|n|cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r Townlong Steppes

Description_lang: At night, the grassland hoppers fill the night with their maddening song. Those unaccustomed to it have spent many a sleepless night serenaded by their mating calls.
Contrary to its benign appearance, mongoose are dangerous carnivores, well known for their ability to hunt venomous snakes that could kill much larger creatures.
Mongoose pups prefer long grass where only their mothers can find them.
The bond between yak and rat is a strange one, and what the rat gains out of the symbiotic relationship is a mystery.
These hedgehogs may be silent, but often are heard the cries of those that foolishly step upon their quills.
Hedgehogs are not at all fond of croquet nor flamingos.
Has been spotted fighting other whelks for prime food sources.
The roaches of the Dread Wastes dwell in the shadows. Some people swear the shadows travel with them.
Unique carapace is prized by trinket makers for its texture and strength.
The emperor crab was named for its regal appearance: the ridges of its shell and its raised claws eerily resembling a crown. One that would pinch your eyes out if you tried to wear it.
Luminescent body used to attract mates.
This delicate insect's wings are often sewn into clothing and armor.
Civets are landbound cousins of the otter and are prized for their heady musks.
The civets are known to guard their young ferociously.
Named for their apparent dancelike behavior when skimming aquatic surfaces, the species uses erratic movements to avoid being devoured by fish and other underwater predators.
Despite its menacing appearance, the yellow-bellied bullfrog was aptly named.
Known to flourish in the rainy season, this insect is drawn to lightning storms.
This species of insect is drawn to the latent energy in shrines, their luminescent appearance adding to the mystique of the places of power.
The markings on the carapace of this cockroach closely resemble that of the Death's Head.
Prefers to dwell in dark caves and feed on Heartblossom nectar.
Legends say that these vibrant emerald beings bring good fortune and safe travels to their owners.
Said to bring good fortune when spotted in autumn.  Known to hide from unfamiliar creatures.
A graceful creature from the isle of Pandaria.
A baby version of the mighty Thundering Cloud Serpent that hails from the far lands of Pandaria.
So cute, yet so epic.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r The Jade Forest|n|cFFFFD200Faction:|r Order of the Cloud Serpent (Exalted)|n

Description_lang: The offspring of Tsulong, hidden away before the corruption of the Sha had fully taken hold of the Terrace of Endless Spring.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r The Jade Forest|n|cFFFFD200Faction:|r Order of the Cloud Serpent (Exalted)

Description_lang: It's red, so it must fly faster.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle:|r The Jade Forest|n|cFFFFD200Faction:|r Order of the Cloud Serpent (Exalted)|n

Description_lang: Known to feast on the tasty plants in Krasarang Wilds.
It keeps looking at me. I think it wants to bite me.
This ferocious skunk can spray an attacker from thirty yards away, temporarily blinding them.  Handle with caution!
Mogu sorcerers, keepers of the secret to bringing stone to life, prefer these stolid companions over more beastly familiars.
The great big world can be a dangerous place for such a tiny, adorable creature.
Water striders serve an important role in Jinyu culture, acting as a mount, means of sending communications, and even a family pet.
Adventurers have reported rare sightings of a monstrous sized emerald shale spider, which the denizens of Deepholm have come to call the Jadefang.
Adult amethyst shale spiders prefer to create their nests against the outer walls of Deepholm.
Constructed from a seemingly impossible mass of gears, springs, wires, and a little something special, this dragonling embodies the spirit of Pandaria as seen through an engineer's goggles.
Jade is naturally rich with life and color, making it the perfect raw material for this gentle companion.  It is said the wind created by their wings can soothe the troubled mind.
While each cub is crafted in the same fashion, tiny imperfections in the gemstones create a unique personality when imbued with life.  They are, however, always playful and friendly.
Many believe (incorrectly) that goldfish have no memories. Trainers who have worked with them know this is clearly not the case and have the bruises to prove it.
This rabbit is much stronger than it looks.
A beautiful kite brought to life by the scribes of Pandaria.
Who knew scribes could make kites?
Not only is it quick, it's loud too!
Seems odd that he doesn't like flies... right?
Careful now, she can get a bit frisky sometimes!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rTime To Open a Pet Store|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rPet Battles

Description_lang: Water spirits are especially mischievous, and are known to frequent the canals of the Stormstout Brewery.
A rolling, explosive member of the Zerg swarm, the baneling deals terrible, terrible damage. Very dangerous in close quarters.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r StarCraft II: Heart of the Swarm Collector's Edition

Description_lang: Legend has it that a seadragon turtle just like this one grew up to become Shen-zin Su, the Wandering Isle. Perhaps your little turtle will grow into something amazing?
The larval form of this moth is world-renowned for creating the finest silk in Azeroth.
This plump red caterpillar is world-renowned for creating the finest silk in Azeroth.
Be careful, he might eat all your crops!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r Sho, Requires Exalted Friendship Faction|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Valley of the Four Winds

Description_lang: Most of Violet's numerous forest strider hatchlings are turned into Faire fare by Stamp Thunderhorn, though a few are raised as mounts or purchased by adventurers looking for a petite purple pet.
Their eerie green light, reminiscent of fel flames, is occasionally seen flitting through the twisted trees of Darkmoon Island.
Don't even think about cheating now.
While smaller than the infamous ravens of Gilneas, crows are no less clever or cunning.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Pet Battle: |rOccasionally appears alongside other creatures during battles on Darkmoon Island.

Description_lang: Terky is as shy as she is adorable, preferring the company of close friends over new ones.
A playful, purring pyromaniac. Don't pet these kittens without fireproof mittens!
Though it appears to be a vaguely-related cousin to the Cinder Kitten, the two creatures actually share no ancestry.
These spirits represent the heart of Pandaria's elemental powers.
The elements of Pandaria can be cute and playful, until their homeland is threatened.
Capable of sitting in even the smallest of boxes, thanks to its ghostly nature.
A rodent of usual size.
Created for one purpose and one purpose alone: to punch little critters, as hard as it possibly can.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Vendor: |rQuackenbush|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rDeeprun Tram|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r500|TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0|t|n|cFFFFD200Reputation: |rBizmo's Brawlpub, Rank 3|n|n|cFFFFD200Vendor: |rPaul North|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rBrawl'gar Arena|n|cFFFFD200Cost: |r500|TINTERFACE\MONEYFRAME\UI-GOLDICON.BLP:0|t|n|cFFFFD200Reputation: |rBrawl'gar Arena, Rank 3

Description_lang: Found in a dusty egg clutch at the back of Maexxna's lair, these creatures are already undead when they hatch.
Loatheb's body is covered in small pods capable of spreading blighted fungal spores up to 1000 yards given proper wind conditions.
Upon exiting the freezing necropolis of Naxxramas, Mr. Bigglesworth promptly found a warm spot in the sun to take a long nap in.
When Gluth died to a band of brave adventurers, these lil' guys were found in the corpse, gnawing on giant, undead bones.
Few of these fiery harbingers remain following Ragnaros' defeat in the Firelands.
These tiny flame imps roam the Molten Core in large swarms and can replenish their numbers rapidly.
The cooled core of Golemagg, it appears to retain some semi-sentient properties.
One of Razorgore's eggs that miraculously survived in Blackwing Lair.
Opponents that face this fierce chromatic monstrosity just hope it doesn't have Time Stop!
A runt of the Black Talon, left to guard the whelps.
This small globule didn't make it back to Viscidus in time to re-form.
An anubisath idol from the Temple of Ahn'qiraj, infused with ancient qiraji magic.
The bane of many an adventurer, to look into its eyes is to truly know madness.
They only get more beautiful as they age.
Hunted by locals for years, this is an extremely rare specimen.
Most people have never read this book.
Never take your eye off of it.
You better believe he knows what time it is.
Originally created by the engineers in the bowels of Gnomeregan, the Fluxfire Feline is a marvel of modern engineering.
The engineering wizards in Everlook created this unique cub as a test model.  Unfortunately a few went rogue and were never recovered.
This model of raptors is produced in the Blade's Edge Mountains.  Their robotic roars are a common sound near Toshley Station.
The runts of Malygos brood, these whelplings are prized for their boundless arcane magics.
Indigenous to the peaks of Kun-Lai Summit, this rare yeti is much more dangerous than it looks.
These beautiful drakes can be found across the shores of Northrend.
Murki is one of the world's rarest species of murloc.
A fel-tainted tome whose secrets are so terrible and bizarre that its pages have taken on an eerie semblance of life. Found on many a warlock's nightstand.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Trading Card Game:|r Betrayal of the Guardian

Description_lang: Touched by lightning, these dangerous rodents should be kept at a safe distance.
Can you believe how cute I am?  Me neither.
Born of sand, these dangerous creatures can form and disperse in the blink of an eye.
Loyal to the Sunreavers from creation, these pint-sized constructs can still pack a punch.
Lightning can be seen flowing across its body, teeth to tail.
This unique raptor was born on the island of Zandalar and transported here along with the rest of the Zandalari army.
These snakes have been known to swallow gnomes in one gulp.
Probably best not to touch it.
Forged in the Throne of Thunder, these tiny creations are servants of the great Dark Animus.
Even at this tiny size, Direhorns are known to wreak havoc on unsuspecting victims.
Something about this creature looks familiar...
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest: |rA Large Pile of Giant Dinosaur Bones|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rIsle Of Giants

Description_lang: These cuddly rascals enjoy basking in the sun, sleeping in the sun, and napping in the sun.
The white fur of the Snowy Panda allows it to hide in the snowbanks of Kun-Lai Summit.
Cousin to the Snowy Panda, Mountain Pandas reside in the lower regions of Kun-Lai Summit.
Don't pet the pointy end. Note: all of the ends are pointy.
Some Pandaren believe G'nathus to be an ancient Zandalari Loa left behind to guard the waters south of Lei Shen's island citadel.
Deadly offspring of the Ancient Mother, Ji-Kun Hatchlings are considered sacred treasures in many cultures.

Every cook's dream wrapped up in a perfect bundle of metal and bolts. Too bad what he cooks up isn't suitable for humanoid consumption. According to Jard's notes, he intends to make this little guy for his friend, Emily Cole.
The Zandalari breed specific Direhorn species for their small size for use as mounts.
The red scales on these fish are believed to be a warning to predators of the Townlong Steppes and the Dread Wastes that their flesh is toxic. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.
These little guys can be found in the waters of the Timeless Isle, or swimming alongside Jewel Danio or Redbelly Mandarin. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.

It is believed that the green coloration and stripes on the tiny green carp serve as camouflage in the waters of the Jade Forest, Valley of the Four Winds and the Krasarang Wilds. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.

These hardy fish can survive in a wide range of climates, from the snow capped mountains of Kun-Lai Summit to the temperate, salty waters of the oceans around Pandaria. Dedicated fishermen can sometimes befriend one.
These tiny minions of Zandalar are adept at stowing away within the cargo holds of the enormous Zandalari warships.
Even at this size, these raptors can eviscerate an entire cow in less than 10 seconds.
These adorable beasts are both cuddly and huggable, provided you do not enjoy having a face.
The oft-forgotten offspring of the Big Bad Wolf, found gorged and asleep in a basket of sweets.
Primary responsibilities include dusting Medivh's many magical artifacts, an activity which has claimed the life, sanity, or physical composition of the many caretakers preceding Moroes.
Upon leaving Netherspace, Malchezaar's Abyssals become strangely distorted by Karazhan's magical protections, rendering them tiny, and much less likely to spontaneously erupt in flames.
A minion of Terestian Illhoof, this tricky imp was left in Karazhan when the portal to the Twisting Nether closed behind it.
An astounding find for the scientific community of Azeroth, who have long pondered, often in taverns, what a baby Sea Giant might look like.
The spawn of Hydross, considered by the elemental community to be the "Earl of Puddles."
It is unknown how Lady Vashj empowers these Fen Striders with their mind-bending powers; even at an early age this creature shows significant psychic ability.
Sent through the Twisting Nether by the great Archimonde the Defiler to terrorize tiny civilizations with their medium-sized stomping noises.
The lanterns carried by Voidcallers bridge the realms of the living and the dead, and often attract wayward ghosts and spirits.
These brightly-colored dragonhawks carry Kael'thas' forces swiftly and unerringly through the nether storm surrounding the Eye.

Though generally an expert at taking stage direction, the show had to be stopped on more than one occasion when Tito and Roar would lock eyes, resulting in an extended chase around the Karazhan Opera House.
The trolls have a long and storied history of summoning hydras. While he might not be the biggest or strongest hydra, Gahz'rooki will bite your fingers quite hard if you get too close.
Val'kyr are considered "unborn" until they vanquish a creature of high nobility.
The dark pools in Primordius' chamber laid stagnant after the fall of the mogu, and murky thoughts began to coalesce.
These malicious oozes are highly sensitive to Primordius' pheromone signature.
Battle pet trainers are strongly encouraged to wash their hands for at least 30 minutes after playing with the filthling.
This budding ancient is a unique variety in Azeroth, created from the ever-living branches of the Great Tree, and can bloom in any season.
Infamous psionic battering ram of the Protoss, Zeradar is also the only archon that can utilize psionic storm. Power overwhelming!
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r StarCraft II: Legacy of the Void Collector's Edition|n

Description_lang: This little guy seems to like to hang out at the fringes of cataclysmic events. There is no evidence to suggest he has anything to do with the cause of these events, though - he's probably just an observer. Or maybe he just gets lost on his trek to other places.
Likely to flip out and kill someone.
Fierce and loyal, Xu-Fu loves to hunt by moonlight.  Once during a full moon, he killed and ate an entire Ironfur Great Bull, prompting a two day nap.
Moonfang's cubs grow into massive, slavering, black-furred killing machines...except for Moon Moon.
Chi-Chi tries to inspire hope with her loud squawk and by chasing, and eventually eating, butterflies.

A master sculptor devoted her life to creating an incomparably beautiful statue, inspired by her love and reverence for Yu'lon.  When the sculptor passed away, Yu'lon breathed a fraction of her essence into the statue, bringing Yu'la into the world.
Always on the lookout for a fight or some tasty grass, Zao keeps his head down and eyes forward.

This handsome little robot is the spitting image of his "Dad", Blingtron 4000.  As a Blingtron's generosity circuits don't mature until they have been built to maximum specification, you shouldn't expect any free handouts from him.
Crane chicks of the Timeless Isle sometimes sing a curious song that calms the nerves and soothes the soul.
The first bombling created in the Underhold, Siegecrafter Blackfuse couldn't bear to see it destroyed, and kept it as a friendly, if explosive, pet.
The Ashleaf Sprites of the Timeless Isle tirelessly protect the vegetation of the island from the burning fury of Ordos and his minions.
Jinyu assassins employ this moth as both a portable decoy and a light source to reveal weak spots in their enemy's armor.
Cats and other curious critters often have short-lived play sessions with this moth that end with a face full of singed hair.
This curious moth is sometimes found interrupting the spells of a wandering mage or warlock.
The waters of Ruby Lake are colored a strange reddish hue, possibly due to the ruby crystals found deep within the mountains of the Timeless Isle.
While fascinated by flowers, the frolicker has also been known to dance with blades of grass and the occasional weed.
Late in life, if the environmental conditions are correct, a Death Adder may shed its skin and undergo a transformation into an Imperial Python.
A small remnant of the power of Y'shaarj that spawned the Sha, a single Drop of Y'shaarj can magnify emotional states for thousands of yards, causing entire towns to shut down in fear or doubt.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Sha of Pride|n|cFFFFD200Raid:|r Siege of Orgrimmar|n|cFFFFD200Difficulty:|r Flexible, Normal or Heroic

Description_lang: Sha-lings reflect the emotional state of their handler, becoming agitated, depressed, fearful, or doubtful depending on the magnitude of negative thoughts around them.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Sha of Pride|n|cFFFFD200Raid:|r Siege of Orgrimmar|n|cFFFFD200Difficulty:|r LFR and Flexible

Description_lang: The Jademist Dancers of the Timeless Isle have a curious attraction to the steam vents of the northwestern shore.

The tiny terror of the Dread Wastes, Kovok prefers a steady diet of "brain food:" mushan brains, human brains, any brains really. This strange nutritional requirement may be tangentally related to his enormous head.
SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Paragons of the Klaxxi|n|cFFFFD200Raid:|r Siege of Orgrimmar|n
